intro: Picrolemma pseudocoffea, commonly known as the false coffee tree, is a species of flowering plant in the Rubiaceae family. It is native to tropical regions of Africa and is characterized by its evergreen leaves and small, clustered flowers. The plant produces small, round fruits that contain a single seed, and it is often found in moist, shaded environments. Its botanical features make it an interesting subject for ecological and horticultural study.
